comment.body: It's April 1, could it be a joke?

> regular backups of all of ZeroNetâ€™s Github source code repositories

Yes, it would be ideal (e.g. we would not lose version history). 
But in case worst happens, we can restore them also from ourselves, from our HDs.
One more reason an internal git appears here, so we (not only nofish) could host the code + history.
Also, the code could be hosted from IPFS, see comment (A) in [ZeroSecurity](/zerosecurity.bit)


Hungary:
Unfortunately, we've heard also other worrying news before from there. :-( Hope @nofish stays safe...
** **
Fossil seems nice. Would be great to hear how much storage it takes for a lots-of-commits project?
